intro: Allium nathaliae var. tepekermense, commonly known as the Tepekermes garlic, is a rare and ornamental plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fragrant, and bulbous structure. The plant typically produces clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves and small, white or pale purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is highly valued by horticulturists and botanical enthusiasts.
